column1: The Great Horn was an heirloom of the House of Húrin until its destruction on 26 February .
The horn was made from the wild white Kine of Araw of Rhûn
column2: which was likened to an wikipedia:Aurochs.
column4: tipped with silver and inscribed with ancient characters. It was said in legend that if the Horn was blown anywhere within the bounds of ancient Gondor
column5: its call would not pass unheeded.

column1: Boromir bore the horn with him when he went to Rivendell
column2: and held it on his lap during the Council of Elrond. After he was chosen to be one of the Fellowship of the Ring
column3: he let the horn ring through Rivendell. He would wind the horn twice more. In reply to the meager horns of the Orcs in Moria
column4: the Great Horn bellowed like the shout of many throats under the cavernous roof. Though it repelled the attackers for a while
column5: they returned after the last echo disappeared.

column1: The last time the horn was rung was shortly before its destruction
column3: on the slopes of Amon Hen

column6: the little help that could come - the rest of the Fellowship - could not make it in time. Though the Uruk-hai were at first dismayed and drew back
column7: they returned more fierce than ever. In the fight that cost Boromirs life
column8: the horn was cloven in two.
